item.title: The Lovinity Community+ Newsletter - August 13, 2016
item.description:
The Lovinity Community+ Newsletter - August 13, 2016

Greetings community! It's Saturday and that means time for another weekly newsletter. A few things have happened since last week, which will be outlined below.

Staff Positions opened

This has been a long time coming, but staff positions for lovinity.org are now open. For a list of positions and their duties, please see 

https://lovinity.org/staff View

. I'm looking for individuals who are mature, respectful, caring, reliable, active online, and friendly. It is also a must that all staff are 18 years old or over for legal reasons; if ever a legal issue comes up, having minors on staff severely complicates the process. Therefore all staff applicants will be required to verify their age via. government-issued ID or birth certificate upon signing up.
If you are interested in being a staff member, please message me Lovinity or create a support ticket (support@lovinity.org or go to About -> Tickets / Contact on site)

The rule on no ad blockers to be enforced

I know, everyone hates ads. However, ads help financially support The Lovinity Community+ in several ways. It also helps people who utilize our advertising services to gain exposure and promotion. Not to mention, we only ever use one ad at the top of the website.

Therefore, we will be beginning to enforce our rule on not using ad blockers on lovinity.org due to the importance of ads for our community. If you use our site with an ad blocker engaged, you will see a notice at the top of the page about our policy on ad blockers with a request to disable them for lovinity.org . Continued use of our website with an ad blocker may result in further staff intervention.

We do offer a way in which you can browse our website ad-free without breaking the ad-blocker rule. That is through donating to our website and getting donor status. To achieve this status and to learn more, please see

https://lovinity.org/donate View

. If you don't have money to donate, you can get one week of ad-free browsing for 500 points by going to the point store: 

https://lovinity.org/pointstore View

.

Small changes to content licence in the Terms

A small change has been made to the Terms of Service under the section "Your Content: Licence". The Terms of Service has neglected to indicate that despite granting us a worldwide, irrevocable, non-exclusive, royalty-free licence to use any content you submit to our site… the content is still owned by you, not us. Therefore, we've modified the terms to indicate such. This change is applicable to all current and future content submitted on our website and takes effect immediately.

Embedly support on our website

From now on, whenever you submit content to our website that contains no manual hyperlinking and contains text references to URLs (aka. you type out a URL or you copy/paste a URL in), our website will change your text URLs into Embedly embeds. What this means is your link will turn into a box that displays a preview of the content that the link takes users to. That way, users will have an idea of what the link will take them to. Youtube videos will also utilize Embedly from now on since the Flash Youtube player is not working (nor ideal anyway).

Be aware that in order for your text URLs to automatically change to Embedly embeds, you must not have included any manual hyperlinks in the content you submit (aka. you used the HTML a tag, you put in a page link, or you used some other means to make a manual hyperlink). If you do, the system will assume you want URLs displayed as normal text to remain as normal text rather than an Embedly preview.

You can also utilize Embedly embeds by using the Comcode media tag (media type hyperlink, or if you're using the comcode tag assistant in the WYSIWYG editor, just type in the URL to the page you want to include as an Embedly preview box).

Goal of the Week

This week's goal is to achieve a total of 31 registered users on our website (that means get 3 new users, as we currently have 28 users) by the end of the day August 19, 2016. The reward if this goal is met is that 3 free virtual gifts will be added that you can give to others via. the points store.

Featured topic

Due to high interest levels, the following topic has been featured:

Topic: [Trigger] Male Sex Trafficking

Topic of the week August 6, 2016

(15 posts)

(Located in Forum home → Activism and Injustice → Sexuality)

View

Featured Post

Our featured Topic of the Week reply was tough to call, but was narrowed down to Hoot  's post on Male Sex Trafficking. You can view her reply at 

https://lovinity.org/forum/topicview/findpost/2294 View

.

 This Week's leaders

Our most active members for this week are @Na- 11 , who was about 4X as active as the average user within the last 30 days, as well as naked , who was about 3X as active as the average user within the last 30 days.

Topics of the week

Here are this week's topics. Remember, a reply could mean your post may be featured by staff and earn you bonus points. In addition, every topic that gets at least one legit reply will also get a reply by me, Lovinity .

Post #2305 by Lovinity on 13th August 2016, 1:21 PM (in topic “Personal Teacher”)

Post

13th August 2016, 1:21 PM
Rating:
#2305
Lovinity
Site director

Personal Teacher

89: Devon’s Story | Chicken Soup for the Soul

89: Devon’s Story | Chicken Soup for the Soul

View


 

Take a look at the above Chicken Soup for the Soul: Volunteering & Giving Back story. In this story, June recaps the time spent with a man named Devon who could not read. Over time, June spent time to teach Devon a variety of things.
 
  • Have you ever been a "personal teacher" for someone before? What did you teach them?
  • What was the experience of teaching something new to someone like? What were the challenges and the benefits?
  • If you had the chance to do it again, would you teach someone else something new? Why or why not?

This is a charm topic, meaning the person whose reply gets the best ratings for their reply (staff breaks ties) by the end of the day August 19 will receive the "Teacher's Desk" charm for their profile's Charms tab. The charm can be pictured here:

Charms entry

Charm name Teacher's Desk Charm
Charm Image
Charm Description This charm was awarded to one person who participated in the charm topic for week of August 13, 2016, regarding being a personal teacher.

https://lovinity.org/forum/topicview/findtopic/263

(Located in Charms home → Activism Charms)

View

Last edit: 13th August 2016, 5:26 PM by Lovinity

(Located in Forum home → Topics of the Week)

View


Post #2306 by Lovinity on 13th August 2016, 1:48 PM (in topic “"Feminist" Men”)

Post

13th August 2016, 1:48 PM
Rating:
#2306
Lovinity
Site director

"Feminist" Men

Beware These 10 Types of Feminist Men — Everyday Feminism

Beware These 10 Types of Feminist Men — Everyday Feminism

Warning: Men who claim to be feminist aren’t immune from toxic behavior. Here are red flags to watch out for that come up in too many feminist men.

View


 

Take a look at the above Everyday Feminism article that explains 10 types of "feminist" men that others should watch out for and be cautious of. Those include but are not limited to men who hide their abusive side behind a feminist mask, those who think womanhood is a competition, and those who in public eye take feminism seriously, but in private eye perpetuate toxic masculinity or rape culture.
 
  • Do you agree with this article that women should look out for men who express any of these traits? Why or why not?
  • Women, Without naming names, do you know of any men who might fit into any of these items? How so? What can you do to help him realize he needs to improve his behavior?
  • Men, do you find yourself expressing any of these 10 qualities yourself? What can you do to ensure it doesn't happen anymore?

This topic is a bonus points topic. Everyone who makes a legitimate reply to the questions above will not only earn points for their post, but will earn 50 bonus points for their reply.

Last edit: 13th August 2016, 5:27 PM by Lovinity

(Located in Forum home → Topics of the Week)

View


Post #2307 by Lovinity on 13th August 2016, 5:44 PM (in topic “Crippling Hearts”)

Post

13th August 2016, 5:44 PM
Rating:
#2307
Lovinity
Site director

Crippling Hearts

Crippling Hearts by WordOfChen on DeviantArt

Crippling Hearts by WordOfChen on DeviantArt

Hey everyone, here is another piece  - Chennie  P.S. If you're a writer, hit my journal to find out about my newest group that can help promote you, for free :'D P.P.S. If you want to sup...

View


 

Take a look at the above short poem on DeviantART, and then reply your thoughts to the below questions.
 
  • Do you agree with the poem in that emotion can be more lethal than death itself? Why or why not?
  • Describe a time in which emotions have crippled your heartstrings. How did you recover from this experience?
  • What advice would you give to others regarding healing from damaged heartstrings or protecting one's heartstrings?

(Located in Forum home → Topics of the Week)

View


Post #2308 by Lovinity on 13th August 2016, 6:06 PM (in topic “Lever”)

Post

13th August 2016, 6:06 PM
Rating:
#2308
Lovinity
Site director

Lever

Imagine that you have a lever. On one side of the lever is yourself, operating it. On the other side of the lever is a life challenge you are currently facing that requires substantial effort to "move".

What is the challenge you face on the other side of the lever? What efforts are you doing in your life to combat that challenge and move it with the lever?

(Located in Forum home → Topics of the Week)

View

That is it for this week's newsletter. If you have any questions or concerns, please email support@lovinity.org or create a ticket under About -> Tickets / Contact. Have a great week!
item.author: support@lovinity.org (Lovinity)

item.title: No Strategies Ramble About Fame/Importance
item.description: (Personal story 1st) Anyone who's famous talking about fame will tell you that it's not as great as it's cracked up to be. There are a lot of hidden costs like the work it takes to stay relevant, the risks of something else becoming more famous than you, the work it takes to attain and maintain fame, and they're all pretty true. I'm not someone famous anymore and when I did have it, I was only famous, in a sense, in a very small community, before July 2013 when my competition increased in size and surpassed me quickly in popularity. The work it took me to get the small amount I had was colossal. It didn't take a lot of brain power because I was just a service provider. I just uploaded tournament videos of Melee to give other people some fame. And it's not really fame for myself. There's no glory in being a silent tournament video uploader. There are only subscriber counts and estimated whole community members The real word I should use to describe my status is something closer to contribution. I did a lot of work to help a lot of people in competitive Melee before that fateful month. The community enjoyed watching tournament videos and it was something they heavily valued. The players on my tournament sets loved playing on them because they loved getting their own Youtube glory and watched to watch themselves for analysis. People paid much more attention to my services that to me and I enjoyed it. Even despite the slavery I put myself through for it. Only 2 people understand that I'm not exaggerating much by calling it slavery There was 1 period when I started growing in popularity quickly for myself relative to my history's growth rates and it felt really fun to become more famous online. There aren't many feeling better than feeling valued. Sadly, I began to encounter 1 of those risks of fame which was losing my fans and it sucks. I peaked at 5,103 subscribers in the end of February and in the beginning of March and ever since then it's been in a decline to where I'm currently at, 4,762 subscribers. I changed my Youtube strategy and some of my fans didn't like it, so they left. 137 of them were due to a Youtube glitch that removed at least 50 of my active viewing subscribers. I used to usually get 100 1st hour views on my moments before it happened. Google knows about the problem and they never fixed it. I guess it's irreversible and they just waited for the flood of Youtube news videos to get uploaded about different news so that people would quietly forget about their fuck up. I remember because I never got a 137 or so subscriber boost yet. I'm sure other Youtubers have noticed too and they're not saying anything because complaining about it again could ruin their images. Who likes complainers? (Melee players) (Generalizable part) I'm not at all a notable example of someone important that people will mention and there are probably about 10,000 people online who hate me. But getting hated isn't as bad as people might think it is. If it really hurts someone, they could simply block the haters if they're not famous. There'd be a small enough number of them to practically do it. This course of action isn't well like though because a lot of people like their freedom of speech. It's a practical strategy if you're trying to be SJW famous though. On a more optimistic perspective, getting hated is part of getting noticed. Just look at anyone famous. You know you've seen them hated I have seen some people hope of becoming important or famous, and I encourage everyone who wants it to work for it. Fame is cool, but fame is basically a lot of people liking someone for something. It benefits a lot of people even if the people receiving a lot of attention are narcissistic. Who cares if they can't care about anyone else as much as they care about themselves? Well, to a degree. Narcissists aren't very good at retaining the attention they get for very long. Just look at my subscriber count and video views Tangent aside, someone's fame/contribution helps other people. What could be better than that? The more people push for fame/importance, the more benefits people can get. Competition can even push competitors to improve what they do. People love better things If you are 1 of these people who want this, go for it. Don't hesitate. The sooner you do it, the better you can achieve fame/importance, the sooner you can learn, the better you can improve your contributions to others. We're only alive for a limited time (No proofreading. This is just for fun)
item.author: support@lovinity.org (naked)

item.title: The Lovinity Community+ Newsletter - August 6, 2016
item.description:
The Lovinity Community+ Newsletter - August 6, 2016

First Saturday of August is here! Time for the weekly newsletter.

Goal of the Week

Last week's goal was to submit 5 entries to the literature section of the website. No entries were submitted, therefore no reward will be offered.

There will be no more goals of the week until the community achieves 500 XP of activity (the more engaging an action is, the more XP it earns). We're quite dead in the community and could really use some activity from everyone. We especially could use some new members, so please recommend this site to your friends and family.

Reply of the week

The featured topic of the week reply for this week comes from Na-11 on the topic "Burning Love". To read her post, go to https://lovinity.org/forum/topicview/findpost/2234#post_2234 .

Topics of the week

Here are this week's topics. Each topic that gets at least 1 reply will also receive a reply from me, Lovinity . In addition, your reply could be featured by staff and earn you 100 points.

Post #2240 by Lovinity on 6th August 2016, 11:15 PM (in topic “[Trigger] Male Sex Trafficking”)

Post

6th August 2016, 11:15 PM
Rating:
#2240
Lovinity
Site director

[Trigger] Male Sex Trafficking

The Male Face Of Sexual Slavery | Fast Forward | OZY
 

Did you know that men can be sex trafficked in addition to women? In fact, statistics show male sex trafficking is on the rise. Check out the above article for more information, and then let me know your thoughts to the questions below:
 
  • The article cites that 98% of sex trafficking victims are women, but that could be a bad number given male victims are under-reported. What do you think the number really is, and why?
  • Why do you think it's hard for men to report being victimized? What can be done to give a safe space for men to report?
  • What can be done in your opinion to abolish sex trafficking as a whole?

(Located in Forum home → Activism and Injustice → Sexuality)

View


Post #2241 by Lovinity on 6th August 2016, 11:19 PM (in topic “Needed: Sense of Humor”)

Post

6th August 2016, 11:19 PM
Rating:
#2241
Lovinity
Site director

Needed: Sense of Humor

73: Sense of Humor Needed | Chicken Soup for the Soul
 

Take a look at the above article from Chicken Soup for the Soul: For Mom with Love. This article talks about how dealing with difficult situations can be improved with humor.
 
  • Discuss a time in which you used humor to better handle a bad situation? Did humor help? Why or why not?

Last edit: 9th August 2016, 12:16 PM by Lovinity

(Located in Forum home → Advice and Wisdom → Emotional)

View


Post #2242 by Lovinity on 6th August 2016, 11:33 PM (in topic “Life Strategy”)

Post

6th August 2016, 11:33 PM
Rating:
#2242
Lovinity
Site director

Life Strategy

We need to have strategies in order to overcome challenges in our life as they hit.
  • First off, talk about a challenge you face in your life.
  • Then, discuss strategies you use to help overcome this challenge you face.
  • Does the strategy work? Why or why not? If not, what do you think you'll try differently next time?

This is a charm topic meaning whoever gets the most likes (staff will break ties) for their reply to this topic will earn the charm you see below, visible on their charms profile tab. Deadline to make a reply to earn this charm is end of the day August 12:

(Located in Forum home → Archives)

View


Post #2243 by Lovinity on 6th August 2016, 11:53 PM (in topic “Drug of Insanity”)

Post

6th August 2016, 11:53 PM
Rating:
#2243
Lovinity
Site director

Drug of Insanity

- by WordOfChen on DeviantArt
 

Take a look at the above short poem on DeviantART
 
  • Have you ever found yourself taking the "drug of insanity"? What was going on? Did taking this "drug" help you handle the circumstances?

(Located in Forum home → Archives)

View

If you have any questions or concerns, please contact staff at support@lovinity.org or on the website go to About -> Tickets / Contact . Have a great week!
item.author: support@lovinity.org (Lovinity)

item.title: The Lovinity Community+ Newsletter - July 30, 2016
item.description:
The Lovinity Community+ Newsletter - July 30, 2016

Welcome everyone! July is closing off, and it's time for our weekly newsletter for The Lovinity Community+.

Website - Network Maintenance

Server4You will be performing network maintenance. As a result, periodic slow-downs and cut-outs of the server are to be expected August 3-4 and 4-5 from 11pm to 5am EDT.

Goal of the Week

Last week's goal was to get 5 new registered users by the end of the day July 29. Sadly, we didn't get any new users. Therefore, no reward will be offered.

This week, I felt since our literature section needs some love (aka. some submissions), the goal is to get at least 5 literature submissions in our website's literature section (click here) by the end of the day August 5. If the goal passes, all submissions made between now and August 5 will get extra promotion on our website and social media.

Featured Topic of the Week reply

Hoot gave another really nice in-depth response to one of last week's topics of the week involving abuse from cis men. Therefore, her reply has been featured for this week. To see what she had to say, go to https://lovinity.org/forum/topicview/findpost/2212#post_2212 .

Community Leaders

Here are this week's leaders according to how active they have been in the last 30 days. The "role points" is their STAR stat (a multiplier… eg. 2X means they were twice as active as the average user). Please note if you are viewing this from the news page on our website opposed to email, this will auto-update to the current standings; it will not reflect the standings at the time of this news post.

Avatar Details Signature
Member: Lovinity

Role points: 21.56

Rank: Administrator
Member: Na-11

Role points: 3.85

Rank: Member 		I don't know what to put in my sig.
Member: naked

Role points: 2.43

Rank: Member

Chance to earn 200 points

Here's an opportunity to earn 200 points:

Post #2222 by Lovinity on 29th July 2016, 9:20 PM (in topic “Math Puzzle for 200 points”)

Post

29th July 2016, 9:20 PM
Rating:
#2222
Lovinity
Site director

Math Puzzle for 200 points

Here is a math challenge for you all. The first person to reply the correct answer to this puzzle will earn 200 points.

You have 6 variables: a, b, c, d, e, and f.
Each of these 6 variables can be one of the following values: 50, 25, 1, 75, 3, or 5.
No two variables have the same value, therefore all numbers are used once and only once.

Now consider this equation (and don't forget order of operations!):

(a + b) * c - d * e - f = 205

Tell me what the correct values are for the variables a, b, c, d, e, and f.

(Located in Forum home → Forum Games)

View

Topics of the Week

Here are our latest topics of the week. Please remember, by making a reply to any of the topics (or even better, multiple topics), you could have your reply featured with a prize of 100 points. In addition, every topic that gets at least 1 legitimate reply from the community will also get a reply from me, Lovinity .

Post #2231 by Lovinity on 30th July 2016, 2:04 AM (in topic “Insomnia”)

Post

30th July 2016, 2:04 AM
Rating:
#2231
Lovinity
Site director

Insomnia

Insomnia by Earnestwriter on DeviantArt
 

Take a look at the above DeviantART poem, written by Earnestwriter . This poem gives a taste of what it's like to have insomnia and not be able to sleep.
 
  • Do you have insomnia? If so, how difficult is it?
  • Can you personally relate to this feeling portrayed in the poem? How or how not?
  • What do you do to try and get rid of your insomnia? Does it help?
  • When you finally can sleep, how does that feel?

(Located in Forum home → Archives)

View


Post #2230 by Lovinity on 30th July 2016, 1:44 AM (in topic “Burning Love”)

Post

30th July 2016, 1:44 AM
Rating:
#2230
Lovinity
Site director

Burning Love

Burning love (flaming heart)… a feeling of warm passionate love that we may have for someone or something.
 
  • Would you say you've ever felt "burning love" for someone or something before? Without revealing names, who or what did you feel burning love for? What about them/it gave you that passionate feeling inside you?
  • Have you ever pursued this person or thing? If so, how did it turn out? If not, why have you decided not to (yet)?

This is a charm topic. The person who receives the highest rating for their reply to this topic (staff will break ties) by the end of the day August 5 will receive the Burning Heart Candle charm as you see below, visible on their profile's charms tab:

Charms entry

Charm name Burning Heart Candle Charm
Charm Image
Charm Description This charm was awarded to one person who participated in the charm topic for the week of July 30, 2016.

https://lovinity.org/forum/topicview/findtopic/254

(Located in Charms home → Fun Charms)

View

(Located in Forum home → Advice and Wisdom → Emotional)

View


Post #2229 by Lovinity on 30th July 2016, 1:26 AM (in topic “Intimate Partner Violence”)

Post

30th July 2016, 1:26 AM
Rating:
#2229
Lovinity
Site director

Intimate Partner Violence

http://everydayfeminism.com/2016/07/reasons-to-learn-about-ipv/
 

Take a look at the above Everyday Feminism article, written by Heidi Guldbaek . In this article, Heidi discusses 5 reasons why everyone should learn about something often not spoken of: intimate partner violence.
 
  • Without revealing names, do you know of anyone... friends or family... who have been involved in intimate partner violence? Briefly mention what you know (aka. what kind of violence, any motives behind it, outcome if applicable).
  • How would you respond to someone who comes forward to you in concern and admits to being involved in intimate partner violence?
  • Did you know that it is not a good idea to suggest to people involved in intimate partner violence that they should "just break up and leave"? What do you think would be a better thing to do or advise?
  • How often do you find yourself stating sayings such as "You (action) like a (insert gender)"? Did you know how sexist these can be and how problematic they can be to society? What can you do to better yourself and avoid being sexist about your interactions?
  • What will you do to be better supportive and conscious of those going through intimate partner violence?
     
Further reading:

http://www.cdc.gov/violenceprevention/intimatepartnerviolence/

(Located in Forum home → Archives)

View


Post #2228 by Lovinity on 30th July 2016, 1:10 AM (in topic “Staycation”)

Post

30th July 2016, 1:10 AM
Rating:
#2228
Lovinity
Site director

Staycation

1: In Praise of the Staycation | Chicken Soup for the Soul
 

Take a look at the above Chicken Soup for the Soul: Tough Times, Tough People story. In this story, Sally Friedman discusses a point in her and her husband's life where they wanted to take a vacation to another place, but felt uneasy given their financial situation. So instead, they took a staycation. Instead of going far, they visited many of the local places they have not had a chance to visit, spending significantly less than if they were to do a vacation elsewhere.
 
  • Have you ever found yourself wanting a vacation but not being able to afford one?
  • If so, would you consider taking a staycation? Why or why not? (Or, if you have taken a staycation before, what was that like?)

(Located in Forum home → Archives)

View

That is it for our newsletter. If you need staff for any reason, please email support@lovinity.org or create a support ticket under About -> Tickets / Contact . Have a great week!
item.author: support@lovinity.org (Lovinity)

item.title: The Lovinity Community+ Newsletter - July 23, 2016
item.description:
The Lovinity Community+ Newsletter - July 23, 2016

Here are the latest happenings from The Lovinity Community:

Radio: The Ike B. Show moving websites

Soon, theikebshow.lovinity.org will be taken down; his new website for The Ike B. Show will be The Ike B Show - WWSU 106.9 FM . It's more fitting to have his site on the new WWSU website given the radio broadcast originates from WWSU despite also airing on Lovinity Community+ radio. So his page and his past broadcasts will be moving there in the next day or two.

Featured Post

I'm going to start including the posts that have been featured from the Topic of the Week responses in our newsletters. So last week, I decided to feature two posts. The first was a random funny story for the "deep in the ocean" topic. It can be found at https://lovinity.org/forum/topicview/findpost/2191 and was written by Na-11.

The second featured post of the week was written by Hoot on the topic "Make-up and Feminism", found at https://lovinity.org/forum/topicview/findpost/2185 .

Remember that participating in the topic of the week means you could have your post featured by staff. If it is featured, it's promoted and you will earn 100 points.

This week's STAR members

Here are this week's STAR members, defined as members who within the last 30 days have been at least twice as active as the average member in our community. "Role points" is the member's STAR stat… for example 2 means they were twice as active as the average member… 3 means 3 times as active, etc.

Avatar Details Signature
Member: Lovinity

Role points: 21.56

Rank: Administrator
Member: Na-11

Role points: 3.85

Rank: Member 		I don't know what to put in my sig.
Member: naked

Role points: 2.43

Rank: Member

Goal of the Week

This week's goal is to achieve 31 verified registered members by the end of the day July 29, 2016 (this means 5 new registered users). If we achieve this goal, everyone will be offered a free 14 days of donor status on their account. So be sure to share our website with your friends and encourage them to join!

Topics of the Week

Here are this week's topics. Be sure to participate in them for a chance to have a post featured and you earning 100 points. Two of the topics this week are Charm topics, meaning you could also earn a charm for your profile. And finally, all topics that get at least one response from the community will also get a response from me, Lovinity .

Post #2206 by Lovinity on 23rd July 2016, 8:52 PM (in topic “Abuse from Cis Men”)

Post

23rd July 2016, 8:52 PM
Rating:
#2206
Lovinity
Site director

Abuse from Cis Men

5 Common Behaviors Cis Men May Not Realize Are Abusive (And How to Stop Them) — Everyday Feminism
 

Take a look at the above Everyday Feminism article, written by Jamie Utt. This article talks about common behaviors that cis men express, and have learned through social construction to express, that are actually abusive. Emotional manipulation is a very common and frequently not talked about behavior.
 
  • If you identify as a cis man:
    • Have you found yourself expressing any of these behaviors before? What happened?
    • Have you been taught, whether directly or indirectly, to show these kinds of behaviors? How were you taught?
    • What would you do to better yourself as a cis man to avoid expressing these kinds of behavior?
  • If you identify as someone other than a cis man:
    • Have you ever encountered a cis man who expressed any of these behaviors? What happened? How did the situation resolve?
    • What do you think needs to happen to break the chain of social behaviors encouraging cis men to act like this?
  • Questions for everyone regardless of identity:
    • Would you agree that the behaviors mentioned in this article are abusive? Why or why not?
    • What personal advice would you give to a cis man regarding these abusive social behaviors?

(Located in Forum home → Activism and Injustice → Violence)

View


Post #2211 by Lovinity on 23rd July 2016, 11:00 PM (in topic “Jazz Band”)

Post

23rd July 2016, 11:00 PM
Rating:
#2211
Lovinity
Site director

Jazz Band

Have you ever been in Jazz band before? If so, what was it like? What instrument did you play? What was your favorite song that you performed?

If you've never been in Jazz band, would you like to be if given the chance? Why or why not? If yes, what instrument would you think you'd play?
 

This is a charm topic, meaning one person who participates in this topic could earn a charm for their profile's charms tab. Whoever gets the most likes on their reply is the winner. Staff will determine tie-breakers. Winner will be determined July 30, 2016. Winner will earn this charm:

Charms entry

The Bird of Faith

The bird of Faith by DraganTheMighty on DeviantArt
 

Take a look at the above inspirational quote / meme from DraganTheMighty .

Magical Football Shield

You are an American football player in the midst of a difficult game of football with a rival team. It is down to the fourth quarter and you're losing by quite a bit. The coach decides to crack out a super secret weapon… the football shield… and gives you the shield to use in the game.
 

Make up a fictional short story about this encounter and how the special football shield helps (or doesn't help) your team win the game.
 

This is a charm topic, meaning that you could earn a charm for participating in this topic. The person who gets the most likes for their response will earn the football shield charm below, which will be visible on their profile's charms tab. If a tie breaker is necessary, staff will determine the tie breaker. Winner will be determined July 30, 2016.

Post #2205 by Lovinity on 23rd July 2016, 8:41 PM (in topic “Adoption - Never Giving Up”)

Post

23rd July 2016, 8:41 PM
Rating:
#2205
Lovinity
Site director

Adoption - Never Giving Up

She Didn’t Give Up on Me | Chicken Soup for the Soul
 

Take a look at the above Chicken Soup for the Soul: Create your Best Future story, written by Sharon Whitley. In this story, a child was given up to the foster system. She threw tantrums as a means to express how lonely and painful she was. When she met a Mom who wanted to adopt her, she was scared that the Mom would change her mind at any point… and thus threw tantrums to try and get the pain over with quickly. But her Mom never gave up on her and knew she was hurting inside. Now, they're a happy family.
 
  • Can you relate to the kid in not being able to express pain and hurt except in certain ways, such as throwing tantrums?
  • Have you ever felt like you were not part of a family before? What happened? How did it resolve itself, if it did?
  • If you had any advice to give to parents seeking to adopt a kid, what would you say?

(Located in Forum home → Archives)

View

That is it for this week's newsletter. If you need staff for anything, please email support@lovinity.org or create a ticket under About -> Tickets / Contact on our website. Have a great week!
item.author: support@lovinity.org (Lovinity)

item.title: Counter-Strike's AWP Is My Favorite Gun In Any FPS
item.description:
Some FPS noobs may complain about sniping, but sniping's 1 of the best things about FPSs, especially with this gun. It's a difficult skill to learn because players have to time their shots carefully, especially with bolt action snipers. When played well, sniping can seem overpowered. They have the farthest range among any weapons. Some rifles can even 1 hit kill, even on body shots. And it's awesome. The AWP can make a player feel so MLG by getting a few nice kills with it. Only an SJW wouldn't want to feel powerful with a weapon of rekkoning

But there are a few flaws with the gun. It has no accuracy when unscoped. Not having a reticle on the screen only makes no scopes more difficult. It's also a disaster at close range. If the player misses, they're going to die. Its fire rate is abysmal and its reload time is even worse. Even in mid to long ranges, missing with an AWP can still cost a player's life. Moving with it ruins accuracy too. Another big cost to it is its financial cost. And even if a player gets a kill with it, they won't get much money in CSGO. There is an Achillies Heel to the gun which is shooting the leg. Even without armor, it'll only do 85 damage. Your enemy might live and kill you. Yet even with the plethora of little flaws, the mere 1 hit kill potential on body shot and scoped accuracy are too good to keep it from being the best gun in the game. If you die, you might want to hope that an enemy doesn't pick it up and use it for their team

What makes the gun fun are the feeling of power from being able to 1 hit kill someone and the high risk, high reward. Getting that feeling of power takes work to achieve. The skill of using an AWP is mostly about reaction time. It's really about aiming as fast as you can and pulling the trigger as soon as it's aimed to hit an enemy. These moments happen super quickly, which creates a short burst of fun. And if you successfully kill, you'll immediately change your actions toward your next immediate thing. You're not stuck aiming after the 1st trigger pull, usually. When you do pull that trigger, it takes you out of zoom and you'll see a nice bolt action animation, giving you new novel stimuli to experience. Everything about the AWP is awesome

But this is all my stupidly typed opinion typed at 4:41 AM as of typing this sentence. I have a huge bias for sniping. Another notable sniper worth praising is Quake 3 Arena's, and not Live's, rail gun. It doesn't guarantee kills as strongly as CS's AWP, but it definitely brings the same high risk, high reward, and feeling of power. Whenever a player shoots with it, they're stuck holding the gun for 2 seconds. That's 2 seconds of time for the enemy to kill you if they're still alive


So what about you? What's your favorite gun?
item.author: support@lovinity.org (naked)
